column4: rather don't install, and clean up your sources.list. you're not running gutsy, are you?
Does nobode else get that update?
compare if you have the version above installed
How can I quickly determine my iptables version?
sources.list seems to contain the default, dutch mirrors
ok, so if there are no dubious repos in your sources.list then update. get your gpg keys fixed
So, I have a lower version of iptables, does that mean that it is okay to install the update that is not authenticated
Oh, wait, synaptic says it is 1.3.6.0debian1-5ub
Sorry, I made a mistake. I have the correct version of iptables. Is there a delay in www.ubuntu.com/usn? Or is it possible that I have found a malicious update?

delays certainly happen. but given the nature of iptables, a certain amount of paranoia seems healthy. I'd investigate wether your signing keys are out of date, or if you have indeed  a mlicious update. The day will com when the bad guys start attacking ubuntu
Ok, do you have a pointer to a website that explains this signing process? Or google search terms?
